articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
In a recent PC Gamer interview done while promoting Elden Ring's Shadow  Of The Erdtree DLC, director Hidetaka Miyazaki was asked about his thoughts on the massive wave of layoffs and studio closures which has been affecting the video games industry lately.


The situation is extremely dire, as even critical acclaim and a fair degree of commercial success won't guarantee the survival of your job or company — even if it's in the hands of multibillion dollar companies like Microsoft and Embracer Group.


Image via Bandai Namco Youtube


Miyazaki assured fans of the Souls series that he'll do whatever it takes to prevent layoffs from happening at From, stating that "at least as long as this company is my responsibility, that's something I would not let happen. So hopefully our players and our…
articles.title: Elden Ring director says layoffs won’t happen as long as he’s in charge

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Destiny 2 has some of the best-named error codes around. While all of them will prevent you from playing, their names can at least make you laugh through the pain. One of the strangest ones I've ever encountered is the Destiny 2 Chicken error code.


The Chicken error code in Destiny 2 is bizarre because the reasoning behind it doesn't seem to line up with when players experience it. I've found this firsthand because the error is, broadly speaking, linked to your connection to the internet. However, I only saw it when my connection was fine, which leads me to believe it might be a bit of a catch-all for various problems around updates. 


How to fix the Destiny 2 Chicken error code


Screenshot by Destructoid


To fix the error code Chicken in Destiny 2, restart the device you're playing o…
articles.title: How to fix the Destiny 2 Chicken error code

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The EA FC 24 Stefan Posch Make Your Mark SBC is the latest addition to Ultimate Team, and the Austrian wingback now has a new special item. 


EA Sports has introduced Posch's promo card as part of a special challenge, which will be great news for the community. As long as you complete all the tasks (there's just one) before the expiry of the SBC, the new card will be added to your Ultimate Team inventory. 


EA FC 24 Stefan Posch Make Your Mark SBC tasks


There might be just one task, but it has certain conditions. These conditions must be satisfied during squad submission in order to earn the Make Your Mark card.


Task 1 - Stefan Posch



Min. 1 Players from: Serie A TIM


Min. 1 Players: Any TOTS or TOTW


Min. Team Rating: 84



Only use a TOTS item to complete this challenge if you have a duplicate card that can be used elsewhere. 


EA FC 24 Stefan Posch Make Your Mark SBC cheapest solutions


The EA FC 24 Stefan Posch Make Your Mark SBC has only one task, so it won't cost too much to complete. Nevertheless, there are plenty of great SBCs like Alejandro Garnacho Make Your Mark to finish in Ultimate Team, so save as much in-game resources as possible. 


Task 1 - Stefan Posch



Thiago Alcantara 84


Stanislav Lobotka 84


Memphis Depay 84


Thomas Muller 84


Ismael Bennacer 84


Casey Stanway 84


Serge Gnabry 84


Griedge Mbock 84


Any 84-rated TOTS item


Luis Alberto 84


Franco Acerbi 83



The 93-rated RB item, which can also play as a CB and RWB, has the Anticipate+ and Intercept+ playstyles. This is a must complete for all beginners due to the available playstyles. Posch is also a starter for Austria, and the card might become an absolute bargain with upgrades. 


If you already have the extra fodder, this SBC could be well worth the fodder. 

The post How to complete Stefan Posch Make Your Mark SBC in EA FC 24 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to complete Stefan Posch Make Your Mark SBC in EA FC 24

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
After you've made it past Trots in Still Wakes the Deep, you'll head outside and hear a strange howling. That noise is coming from Muir, another member of the rig's crew who has been tragically mutated by whatever the drill crew ran into, and he's lonely. 


Muir is a towering creature who patrols a large area in search of any surviving crew so he can absorb them into his mass. When you encounter him, he quickly grabs Dobbie before you find Innes, another survivor who tells you where to go. The only way forward is around Muir, so you're going to have to get back to sneaking around and throwing objects to distract him from where you're hiding. 


How to get past Muir in Still Wakes the Deep


Screenshot by Destructoid


This encounter with Muir is split into a few stages. The first stage re…
articles.title: How to get past Muir in Still Wakes the Deep

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
It wouldn't be a new Warframe update if there weren't a handful of new materials for you to collect. Duviri Paradox is the best example of a recent update that introduced a lot of materials, but each update tends to include a couple. The release of Jade Shadows is no different, and how you can use them can be a little confusing. Here's what Vestigial and Volatile Motes are in Warframe.


How to get and use Vestigial and Volatile Motes in Warframe


Vestigial and Volatile Motes are acquired from the new Ascension game mode, accessible through the node Brutus, Uranus. During the mission, you'll fight various enemies that will occasionally drop Vestigial or Volatile Motes, which can then be picked up. These come in at a few each run but typically give you more Vestigial Motes than Volatile.


Image via Destructoid.


These need to be taken to the Larunda Relay orbiting Mercury. Once there, you want to head to Ordis, who's found in the Mission Control room on the right side of the relay. Alternatively, you can use the Fast Travel option in the Pause Menu to go straight to Ordis. Here, you're able to access several shops. The Release Vestigial Motes shop lets you access Jade's component blueprints alongside other useful items such as Arcanes. Other shops let you spend your Volatile Motes on other assorted items, including several cosmetics.


Image via Destructoid.


Be mindful that Volatile Motes are only available as part of the Operation: Belly of the Beast event that launched with the Jade Shadows update. Once the Operation disappears, only Vestigial Motes will be earnable. If you want some of the cosmetics in Ordis' shop, you'll need to move fast.

The post What are Vestigial and Volatile Motes in Warframe? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: What are Vestigial and Volatile Motes in Warframe?

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
While not every Warframe update includes one, the updates that include new cinematic quests tend to be the most interesting ones. Between updates like The New War, Whispers in the Walls, and now Jade Shadows stick out more when you need to deal with story tidbits and cool setpieces instead of a new mission type to farm. Here's how to access the latest main story quest for Warframe, known aptly as Jade Shadows.


How to play the Jade Shadows main quest in Warframe


Image via Destructoid.


The Jade Shadows quest becomes accessible after completing the New War main quest. This will require a lot of other quests to be completed beforehand, mostly centered around the main story. If you're only partway through, you should focus on that instead of concerning yourself with most of the new update. However, those who have completed The New War can access the quest through the kiosk on the left of the Orbiter's cockpit. Find the Jade Shadows quest in the menu, click on it, and select Begin in the bottom right.


If you are going to jump into the quest, there are a few things you should keep in mind. The mission is 30-40 minutes long depending on how quickly you tend to speed through content. You also won't be able to access the rest of the game until the mission is complete, so you should get anything else you want done taken care of now.


Upon completion, you'll get a handful of nice cosmetics along with the Jade main blueprint, granting you access to her provided you have her parts already. If you don't, they can be acquired through the new Ascension game mode on the node Brutus, Uranus.

The post How to access the Jade Shadows quest in Warframe appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to access the Jade Shadows quest in Warframe

articles.author: Jamie Moorcroft-Sharp
articles.description:
Still Wakes the Deep takes the horror of the sea and drags it into a virtual reality where you're small, trapped, and must try to escape an entity you cannot understand. It's brutal cosmic horror that borrows from some of Lovecraft's best work and manages to craft a survival horror game that I believe is going to be remembered by the horror community for years to come. 


Developer The Chinese Room is perhaps best known for games like Everybody's Gone to the Rapture and Dear Esther, narrative titles that do a great job of telling a compelling story through gameplay that's generally okay. Still Wakes the Deep kicks things up a notch. Set on an oil rig in the North Sea in 1975, you play as Caz, an electrician who took a job on the rig to get out of Scotland and dodge some police charges. Whi…
articles.title: Review: Still Wakes the Deep

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The EA FC 24 Micky Van de Ven Make Your Mark SBC is now live in Ultimate Team, and it looks like another wonderful addition to the recent special challenges. 


While a bulk of the Make Your Mark items are available in packs, EA Sports has been adding regular SBCs featuring promo cards. You can add the new Van de Ven item by completing all the tasks that are part of the challenge before it expires from Ultimate Team. 


EA FC 24 Micky Van de Ven Make Your Mark SBC tasks


The EA FC 24 Micky Van de Ven Make Your Mark SBC has three different tasks, and both of them have separate set of conditions. To complete the challenge, the conditions of both tasks will need to be satisfied during squad submission. 


Task 1 - Netherlands



Min. 1 Players from: Netherlands


Min 1 Players: Any TOTS or T…
articles.title: How to complete EA FC 24 Micky Van de Ven Make Your Mark SBC

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 3 introduces numerous events and features, from the Metallica and Fallout collaborations to expanding the in-game map to include a few new locations. You'll also spot several weapons, with a powerful laser gun among your many options. Here's how to get the Tri-Beam laser rifle in Fortnite.


Where to get the Tri-Beam Laser Rifle in Fortnite Chapter 5, Season 3


The main ways to get the Tri-Beam laser rifle is to find it as floor or chest loot or eliminate an enemy wielding one. While this is luck-dependent, you'll often find one if you encounter a lot of other players or frequently loot chests, as it's a relatively common drop compared to legendary and mythic-grade weapons. Similarly, if someone else got lucky and found, you can defeat the min combat and quickly pick up their laser rifle to take it for yourself.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Alternatively, you can also talk to the T-60 Power Armor NPC between the Nitrodrome and Mount Olympus. You'll spot the character in a small shack, where they'll sell you the Tri-Beam laser rifle for 300 gold bars. If you have enough gold bars on you, you can buy the gun to use it instantly, allowing you to get started on your quests early on. Just be careful while doing this, as you might find other players also trying to get the rifle. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


Once you get your hands on the Tri-Beam laser rifle, you can use it to complete weekly quests, progress through seasonal missions, or try something new. While the gun doesn't boast any special abilities, it has unlimited ammo and decently high damage, making it a good option throughout most of your match.

The post How to find the Tri-Beam Laser Rifle in Fortnite appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to find the Tri-Beam Laser Rifle in Fortnite

articles.author: Christine Choi
articles.description:
Dual Destiny is a cooperative quest in Destiny 2 that will test your coordination skills. Here’s what you and your partner will need to do to beat Dual Destiny and get the exotic class item reward.


If you don’t have access to Dual Destiny yet, we have a separate guide on how to unlock this quest. 


Dual Destiny fireteam requirements


In order to start the Dual Destiny quest, you’ll need a fireteam of two players. You can be any class, but one player has to be a Light subclass (Arc, Solar, Void) and the other must be a Darkness subclass (Stasis, Strand). Prismatic can count for either Light or Darkness, depending on what your party needs. 


When you begin the quest, you’ll see your alignment in the bottom left corner. This won’t change throughout the quest, so remember whether you are …
articles.title: How to complete the Dual Destiny quest in Destiny 2

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
For those viewers who were left feeling a little confused by the reveal of Sutekh in the latest episode of Doctor Who, The Legend of Ruby Sunday, there is hope in the shape of Tales of the TARDIS. 


Tales of the TARDIS was originally created to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the show, and usually features previous iterations of the Doctor and their corresponding companions on board the Memory TARDIS, a TARDIS which features significant items and designs from every generation of Doctor Who. However, this week’s episode will be slightly different as the Doctor and Ruby enter the Memory TARDIS and travel back in time to 1911. 


Viewers will be able to get some answers as to who Sutekh is, accompanied by the Doctor and Ruby as they take a pause in events currently happening and take some time to consider what they've been through over the last few weeks. 


Image via BBC


According to the BBC, the “timeless classic” Pyramids of Mars has been turned into feature-length omnibus episode with updated visuals and a cosmic makeover. Taking multiple episodes and condensing them into the 75 minute run-time of Tales of the TARDIS is no mean feat, but it should provide some answers for those who still have questions regarding Sutekh. 


There have previously been seven episodes of Tales of the TARDIS, looking back on everything from the Cybermen to Viking curses, though this will be the first time we’ve seen a current Doctor experiencing events of his previous regenerations. With Empire of Death being released just one day later, this might be the last chance to catch up on exactly who Sutekh is, and why he's so dangerous.


Tales of the TARDIS will air live on BBC4 in the UK on June 20 at 8 p.m. GMT, and will be available to watch on BBC iPlayer at any time after that point.  

The post Doctor Who: The Doctor and Ruby will feature in a new Tales of the TARDIS episode before Empire or Death appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Doctor Who: The Doctor and Ruby will feature in a new Tales of the TARDIS episode before Empire or Death

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
Amazon Games announced today that the NCSOFT-developed MMORPG Throne and Liberty finally has a global release date and it is September 17, 2024. Originally titled Project TL, Throne and Liberty is seen by many as somewhat of a spiritual successor to NCSOFT's popular Lineage MMORPG series. The MMO has already been released in South Korea, but has been receiving some updates and changes before Amazon Games brought it to the global audience.




Throne of Liberty features a dynamic PvP system that focuses on conquest battles and castle sieges. Winning these battles allows guilds to get valuable buffs and guild resources that increase the guilds ability to compete in PvE as well, creating a system where all facets of gameplay benefit each other.


The Castle Siege system is said to support thousands of players as they fight over a castle, using unique strategic resources such as Golems to join them in the fight.



In Throne and Liberty, there are numerous goals that can be achieved through guilds, including guild rankings, Conquest Battles, and Castle Sieges. Guilds are at the core of strategic competitive battles. Guild members not only work together to achieve common goals, but also benefit from a guild reward system that includes distributing raid items and sharing rewards from events among members. However, the greatest appeal of a guild is the sense of belonging it provides, ensuring that you always have companions by your side.
- Moonseop Lee, Game Design Director at NCSOFT



Amazon Games also announced an upcoming open beta taking place from July 18 to July 23 on all platforms with cross-play enabled.


Throne and Liberty will release on September 17 on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S and will feature cross-platform play across all three platforms.

The post NCSOFT MMORPG Throne and Liberty set to release September 17, open beta next month appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: NCSOFT MMORPG Throne and Liberty set to release September 17, open beta next month

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
In 2024, playing EA FC 24's old-gen version might not be on the wishlists of many players (unless they're forced by choice of their consoles), and there are plenty of reasons behind that.


However, a lot of community members have recently voluntarily switched to playing the old-gen version on their next-gen consoles (this isn't possible on PC). At first, doing so might seem counter-intuitive, as the current-gen version has plenty of added advantages and new technology like HyperMotion. However, certain benefits come with the older version, especially if you're frustrated with how HyperMotion works in the game.


Why should you choose EA FC 24 old-gen version?


HyperMotion has been a really interesting addition to EA FC 24 (this year marks the third version of the technology), and it has …
articles.title: Is EA FC 24’s older-gen version better?

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Street Fighter 6 is undoubtedly a fantastic fighting game, and it's only going to get better thanks to its second line-up of DLC characters, which includes SNK guest stars Terry Bogard and Mai Shiranui. However, there does remain one point of contention: the game's microtransactions and monetization model. Yet despite the amount of complaints lobbied against them, it sounds like Capcom has no plans to adjust the microtransactions.


Recently, Kotaku got to speak with Street Fighter 6 director Takayuki Nakayama and producer Shuhei Matsumoto, and it asked them about the discontent surrounding the microtransactions. There is a lot of additional content in Street Fighter 6, such as customization items, that you can't just buy with real money. You have to first purchase the in-game Fighter Coin…
articles.title: Despite complaints, it doesn’t sound like Street Fighter 6 will make changes to its microtransactions

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Elden Ring’s first and only DLC Shadow of the Erdtree is almost upon us. Ahead of its release on June 21, FromSoftware has revealed the minimum and recommended specs for PC players.


This particularly comes in handy for players to know exactly what specs their desktops or laptops must have, in order to run the DLC. The specifications are not too different from what was required to play Elden Ring when it launched, so if Elden Ring runs on your system right now, it should be able to let you run the DLC as well. Check out the minimum and recommended specs below.


Image via Bandai Namco


Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree minimum system requirements


The following specs are required to at least run Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree, which typically would be needed to run the game at its lo…
articles.title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree PC system requirements revealed

articles.author: Filip Galekovic
articles.description:
After a prolonged period of not getting any patches or hotfixes at all, Helldivers 2's recent Viper Commandos update ended up being almost universally beloved by the community. A few problems remain, but it's good stuff all around, and the whole Arrowhead Games studio is to blame for this.


The concept of "blame" is, of course, quite positive in this case, and the recently self-deposed former CEO of Arrowhead Games, Johan Pilestedt, has gone on record to make sure that Helldivers 2 players understand that the great new update was a team effort through and through. Specifically, Pilestedt says he had noticed some people giving him virtually all the credit for the Viper Commandos update, and he wanted to clear the air on this matter.




Helldivers 2 is a team effort, always


"I want to ma…
articles.title: Helldivers 2 director underlines the importance of his team in delivering the latest update

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
Back in September 2023, GameCube card-based RPG duology Baten Kaitos made its way back to a Nintendo platform with the launch of Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster. While it may have been easy to miss last night's announcement, the collection is now available on Steam.


The Steam drop of the remastered set — which includes Baten Kaitos: Eternal Wings and the Lost Ocean and Baten Kaitos Origins — is priced at $49.99. Those who pick it up between now and July 1 will get upgraded to the Month 1 Edition, which packs the games with a digital art book. As Bandai Namco details, the art book includes "concept art, character designs, historical documents, and the latest visuals" for both games. All of the content within is in Japanese. 




Baten Kaitos series character designer Nakaba Higurashi whipped up a new illustration to commemorate the Steam release.


In addition to updated visuals, the remastered versions of the Baten Kaitos games add in some progression-focused features for those who just want to experience the story. There's the ability to turn on No Encounters so you can sail through the game without having to worry about battles. If you want to fight but don't want battles to impede progress, there's also an Instant KO setting that lets you defeat enemies in a single attack. 


Image via Bandai Namco


Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster is 10 percent off on Steam for a limited time, so if you want to grab it now, you can do so for $44.99. 

The post Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster goes live on Steam appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster goes live on Steam

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Did you know that Ark: Survival Ascended, a game all about surviving on a prehistoric island inhabited by dinosaurs, has added Power Rangers-themed content of all things? I didn't until I woke up this morning, and it may just be the most bizarre gaming crossover of 2024.


I suppose it does make some sense since the crossover is specifically with the original Mighty Morphin Power Rangers team, whose giant Zords took the form of prehistoric creatures, like a tyrannosaurus rex and a saber-toothed tiger. It's also a mod that's completely free to download, letting you dress your character up as one of the five original Rangers, complete with unique animations, and there are even optional skins for your weapons and specific dinosaurs, turning them into the Dinozords. Sadly, the Green Ranger and…
articles.title: Ark: Survival Ascended’s first crossover only makes me yearn for a big-budget Power Rangers game

articles.author: Eric Van Allen
articles.description:
The Summer Game Fest may be over, but Nintendo is hosting its big summer showcase today. The publisher is broadcasting a new Nintendo Direct, airing roughly 40 minutes of news about upcoming Switch games, though there won't be any mention of the console's successor here.


Instead, what we're likely to see is the twilight roll-out of the Switch's library. A few new games, a few old ones, and maybe the return of a long-lost giant, hiding away for years in Nintendo R&D. Here's everything we saw today.


Everything shown in the June 2024 Nintendo Direct





A surprise reveal of Mario & Luigi: Brothership opens the show. It's the first Mario & Luigi game in years, and though former series studio Alphadream rode off into the sunset, it looks like the series is returning under Nintendo. The loo…
articles.title: Everything shown in the Nintendo Direct for June 2024

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
As part of today's Nintendo Direct, Square Enix revealed the open RPG Romancing SaGa 2, originally released back in 1993, has gotten the full remake treatment. The Romancing SaGa series allows players to forge their own stories as they choose from an arsenal of main characters and expand their legacy, passing down powers and skills with each generation. Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven is headed to Switch on October 24, 2024.




Based on the trailer, it looks like Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven features some pretty substantial upgrades both graphically and gameplay-wise.


In Romancing Saga 2 players must oversee a Royal Court, leading an empire to longevity and prosperity by dictating its economy, technology, city construction, and magic. At its core, Romancing SaGa 2 is about prospering over generations as opposed to focusing on the short term.


This is another one I've yet to play, primarily because it was originally released in Japan and I just never got around to playing. It looks like a great time to finally get into it with the Revenge of the Seven remake.


Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven is scheduled to release on Nintendo Switch on October 24, 2024.

The post Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven coming to Switch this October appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven coming to Switch this October

articles.author: Christian Dawson
articles.description:
Bungie has been dipping deep into the well of secrets and mechanics with Destiny 2: The Final Shape. With the release of the Echoes Episode, players are likely to encounter some phantoms on Nessus. Unlocking their secrets is the key to accessing the new Enigma Protocol activity.


Secrets upon secrets in the Echoes Episode


Decode: The Cistern


Upon landing in The Cistern on Nessus, after completing the introductory mission for Echoes, you'll spot what appears to be a Prismatic figure. As you near, they'll disappear, leaving only a ring. Standing in the ring begins populating your HUD with random letters and numbers.


Proceed down the path as if you were heading for the Well of Flame and there will be another Prismatic figure. They'll disappear on approach, just like the other, but this…
articles.title: How to unlock the Enigma Protocol activity in Destiny 2

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Given the success of Elden Ring, we're undoubtedly going to get a sequel someday, but it also wouldn't be surprising if its open world formula influenced other future FromSoftware games too. However, Elden Ring director and studio president Hidetaka Miyazaki doesn't sound keen on the idea of having every game FromSoftware makes be open world.


Ahead of the launch of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, Miyazaki sat down with GameSpot to discuss Elden Ring's development and the future of FromSoftware. When asked if open world games will now serve as a new baseline for the studio, Miyazaki downplayed the possibility: "I wouldn't necessarily say that open world is going to become the new base or foundation or standard of the company. ... We have a lot of game directors and designers who are growin…
articles.title: Elden Ring director doesn’t think open world games will become the new ‘standard’ for FromSoftware

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
The one last thing of today’s Nintendo Direct is none other than the elusive Metroid Prime 4. Announced back in (holy crap) 2017, this is the first time we’ve actually seen gameplay. It will be arriving in 2025.


I’d say I was shocked, but they had to show it at some point. The gameplay shown off looks a lot like the Metroid Prime we’ve become accustomed to. There's even series' antagonist, Dark Samus, stepping in at the end.


Samus is in her classic Varia suit (setting it before Metroid Fusion) and can roll into a ball. It looks like lock-on aiming has returned, which means it will feel natural to me. Rejoice! Scanning is back. The trailer opens with a battle between Federation soldiers and the Space Pirates, but it closes with a look at a more peaceful environment that could be taken straight from a JRPG.


Anyway, take a look for yourself:




Metroid Prime 4 is coming to Switch sometime in 2025.

The post Metroid Prime 4: Beyond gameplay trailer finally arrives, releases in 2025 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond gameplay trailer finally arrives, releases in 2025

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Nearing the end of the 2024 Nintendo Direct, Spike Chunsoft, the creators of the Danganronpa series, announced their latest game, The Hundred Line: Last Defense Academy. The Hundred Line -Last Defense Academy- is arriving as a Nintendo Switch exclusive in early 2025.




Boasting Danganronpa's signature art style and narrative parallels, The Hundred Line -Last Defense Academy- takes place in an apocalyptic world where mysterious, hostile creatures are invading. Playing as the protagonist, Takumi Sumino, your goal is to survive 100 days as you and your fellow classmates defend your school against these creatures. 


Right from the get-go, we see its resemblance to previous Spike Chunsoft games like those from the Danganronpa series. Some of the most notable similarities are the existence of a small animal mascot, the forced enrolment of 16 students in a questionable school, and the collapse of society as monsters destroy everything in their path. The premise is the same outside of the absence of murder mystery and case-solving, but its gameplay is vastly different.


Image via Spike Chunsoft (Nintendo Direct)


Rather than being a primarily visual novel-based game, The Hundred Line -Last Defense Academy- features a combat grid where you'll arrange your characters and defeat waves of enemies, with things getting increasingly challenging as you progress through the 100 days. While little is known about the specifics of gameplay and combat, we at least know there's some variety here. 


The Hundred Line -Last Defense Academy- will launch on Nintendo Switch in early 2025. No exact release date is currently known.

The post Danganronpa creators announce The Hundred Line Last Defense Academy, releasing in 2025 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Danganronpa creators announce The Hundred Line Last Defense Academy, releasing in 2025

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Following the previous Ace Attorney collections, Capcom is doing one for the Ace Attorney Investigations spin-off duology. Not only does this mean the two games will be available on modern hardware, but this marks the second game's debut in the West.


For context, the original Ace Attorney Investigations, which sees you play as prosecutor Miles Edgeworth as he solves crimes, came out in 2010. Its sequel launched just a year later in 2011, but only in Japan, with Capcom opting not to localise it. Fans did come together to make their own translation, but many had assumed the game would never officially come to the West.




Capcom seems eager to push Ace Attorney more nowadays, as evidenced by how all the mainline games are readily available. This includes The Great Ace Attorney duology, which was also Japan-only for many years. All in all, fans of the series are eating well.


This new collection will feature enhanced visuals, with more fluid and detail character animations, but there will be an option to switch to the original graphics as seen in the DS versions. Obviously, this won't be a Switch exclusive and will also launch on PC via Steam, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. Pre-orders are already available for the collection, which is scheduled to launch on September 6.

The post Ace Attorney Investigations Collection means we can finally play the second game appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Ace Attorney Investigations Collection means we can finally play the second game

articles.author: Ryan Lemay
articles.description:
Instead of a Zelda remake, which some fans may have expected, Nintendo surprised everyone with a brand new series entry, putting players in the princess's shoes instead. 


The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom announcement trailer started like any previous installment. Link battles off a horde of enemies to free Zelda from a crystal. However, this time around, Link gets sucked into a strange rift, and this time it's up to Zelda to step up to the plate and save Hyrule. Instead of wielding a sword, Zelda wields a mysterious staff that can duplicate items called echoes. Once the princess learns an echo of something she can re-create it however many times you like to help traverse the map and move past obstacles. 




Wooden boxes, old beds, tables, and water blocks are just a few items Zelda can use. The first trailer gives players a first look at how the duplication system works. For example, Zelda duplicated multiple beds to scale a wall. Instead of traditional combat, the staff can create echoes of monsters, and each enemy has a unique set of abilities that can be used for different situations. Nintendo set out to create an experience that will be different for players, based on how they decide to use echoes. 


The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom launches on September 26, 2024. Nintendo also announced a new Nintendo Switch Lite Hyrule edition to celebrate the new title that will also be available on the same date. 

The post The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom puts the princess in the lead this September appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom puts the princess in the lead this September

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
The 2024 Nintendo Direct revealed the latest installment to the Mario Party series, Super Mario Party Jamboree. Fortunately, you won't have to wait too long to jump into the friendship-making (and destroying) actions with your friends, as it's releasing this year on October 17, 2024.




Super Mario Party Jamboree is the biggest game to launch in the series yet, with over 110 minigames, seven game boards, and up to 20-player support in an exclusive Koopathlon mode. You'll jump onto an island resort and, much like previous games in the series, travel around the board to sabotage your friends and claim the most stars to win the match. It also features mostly new game boards, with two from the first two Mario Party games, Mario's Rainbow Castle and Western Land, making a grand return.


Super Mario Party Jamboree will be released as a Nintendo Switch exclusive on October 17, 2024.

The post Super Mario Party Jamboree is arriving this October appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Super Mario Party Jamboree is arriving this October

articles.author: Zoey Handley
articles.description:
There was a lot of exciting news for retro gamers in the Nintendo Direct. One that got me good was the reveal of the Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection. This collection brings together such out-of-reach licensed classics as The Punisher and Marvel vs. Capcom 2.


Okay, here’s the trailer:




And here’s the list of games. Capitalization is all Capcom marketing:



X-MEN CHILDREN OF THE ATOM


MARVEL SUPER HEROES


X-MEN VS. STREET FIGHTER


MARVEL SUPER HEROES vs. STREET FIGHTER


MARVEL vs. CAPCOM CLASH OF SUPER HEROES


MARVEL vs. CAPCOM 2 New Age of Heroes


THE PUNISHER



This is extremely exciting to me. I’m always thrilled when old licensed games get re-released because I know it’s often a lot of hoops for the publisher to jump through. Marvel Vs. Capcom 2 is probably the top of the heap, but that doesn’t mean that the others included aren’t great on their own. 


The more obscure entry here is The Punisher.  Rather than a fighting game,  it's a beat-’em-up where you play as the eponymous anti-hero and Nick Fury. It’s no Alien vs. Predator (hopefully, one day), but it’s appropriately violent and an excellent arcade title.


It comes with some bells and whistles, too. There will be Online modes with rollback netplay, and training modes for all the fighting games. There is also a spectator mode, a jukebox, and screen filters.


Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics will be released later this year for Switch, PS4, and PC.

The post Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection is full of retro licensed goodness appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection is full of retro licensed goodness

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
The hardcore rogue-lite turn-based RPG Darkest Dungeon 2 is coming to Nintendo Switch. Red Hook Studios announced the news during today's Nintendo Direct, with a release date set for July 15, 2024. Like the original Darkest Dungeon, Darkest Dungeon 2 has been optimized to make use of the Nintendo Switch with this release.




The Nintendo Switch release of Darkest Dungeon 2 has been optimized to run on the Switch and take advantage of the touchscreen. Alongside the base game, the Binding Blade DLC which adds two new heroes, a special questline, a wandering boss, and more is also available as part of an Darkest Dungeon 2 Oblivion Edition.


In Darkest Dungeon 2, players embark on a journey through five campaigns each with its own boss and mechanics as they form a party, equip their stagecoach, and engage in battle across a decaying landscape striving to avert an apocalypse.


Darkest Dungeon 2 releases on Nintendo Switch on July 15, 2024.

The post Darkest Dungeon 2 delves into Nintendo Switch next month appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Darkest Dungeon 2 delves into Nintendo Switch next month

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
During the newest Nintendo Direct, four fan-favourite classics were confirmed to be coming to the Nintendo Switch's online service. And best of all, they're dropping later today.


The first two are a pair of Game Boy Advance games: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past Four Swords and Metroid: Zero Mission for Game Boy Advance. The former is a compilation title that includes a GBA remake of the beloved SNES game A Link to the Past, and a multiplayer spin-off that sees four Links team up and explore randomised dungeons. This will allow for online co-op.


Image via Nintendo


As for Metroid: Zero Mission, it's a GBA remake of the very first Metroid game, letting you experience an updated re-telling of Samus' first adventure. It may not be as fancy looking as Metroid Prime 4, but it's still worth playing.


The other two additions are a pair of Nintendo 64 games: Turok: Dinosaur Hunter and Rare's original Perfect Dark. Both of these are first-person shooters, with Turok being all about, well, hunting dinosaurs, while Perfect Dark is set in an alternate future where agent Joanna Dark goes on a mission to thwart an evil corporation. Perfect Dark will also feature online multiplayer. These two will be exclusive to Nintendo's new catalogue of mature rated titles.

The post Perfect Dark, Turok, and more are coming to Nintendo Switch Online today appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Perfect Dark, Turok, and more are coming to Nintendo Switch Online today

articles.description:
In The Hundred Line you are Takumi Sumino, a student who is suddenly enrolled at the The Last Defense Academy when an outbreak of monsters threatens his life and the lives of his fellow students. Takumi is part of a group of students at the school who must defend it against monsters in grid-based strategy encounters for 100 days. The academy is apparently very secretive and you will lose classmates over the course of the game, which is not surprising considering this game is from the creators of the Danganronpa series. In the Danganronpa games, the mortality of nearly every character is always on the line.

The Hundred Line: Last Defense Academy is coming to Nintendo Switch in 2025.

Nintendo has announced the latest installment of the Mario Party series. Super Mario Party Jamboree is a brand-new entry in the franchise, but it’s looking as if the general thrust of play remains mostly intact, with a few notable additions.

The reveal trailer shows Mario and friends descending on a small archipelago of islands that make up a massive resort. Across the many boards, players can encounter 110 different minigames.

Jamboree includes five new boards – Mega Wiggler’s Tree Party, King Bowser’s Keep…

articles.description: For years, fans of the Legend of Zelda have clamored for the titular princess to star in her own game, but even as she's become a more prominent character in recent entries, the Zelda-led Zelda game has yet to appear on store shelves. In today's Nintendo Direct, that wish was finally granted; in The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, it's up to Princess Zelda to save Hyrule when Link is captured.

The game has had its various tribulations since its announcement in 2017. It was originally being developed by Bandai Namco, but was later restarted and moved over to Retro Studios, the developer behind the the first three Metroid Prime games.

articles.author: Matt Miller
articles.description:
Today’s Nintendo Direct brought news of the welcome return of Donkey Kong to Switch. Donkey Kong Country Returns HD is headed for release on January 16, 2025.

The new version looked great in its reveal trailer today, which showed off DK and his little buddy, Diddy Kong, making their way through a slew of jungle-themed environments, collecting bananas, popping barrels, and even riding Rambi the Rhinoceros.

The new remaster is set to include 80 levels, which means it will also have all the extra levels that appeared in the 2013 3DS port. The trailer also reveals plans for two-player local cooperative play.

Check our the new trailer for yourself below.
articles.title: Donkey Kong Country Returns HD Is On The Way To Switch

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Disney Illusion Island was one of our favorite platformers from last year, thanks to its charming visuals, engaging combat-free design, and toe-tapping soundtrack. If you haven't checked it out yet, today is a great day to do so, thanks to the free update that adds a brand-new chapter of gameplay.

Mystery In Monoth sees Mickey and friends lend a helping hand to Monoth's greatest detective, the trench coat-clad Dash Dolphin. In addition to what appears to be new levels packed with platforming challenges, players will get to experience some mystery-solving as well by collecting clues and evidence and connecting them using a classic bulletin board with thumbtacks and red string.

You can return to the land of Monoth to snoop and sleuth when the Mystery In Monoth update drops later today.
articles.title: Free Illusion Island Update, Mystery In Monoth, Launches Today

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
During today's Nintendo Direct, developer Mistwalker announced that its popular RPG Fantasian would be making the leap to Switch later this year in an enhanced version called Fantasian Neo Dimension. The title arrived as an Apple Arcade exclusive in 2021 and currently holds an 80 out of 100 on reviews aggregate site Metacritic. It also won the award for Mobile game of the Year at the 25th Annual DICE Awards. 

Mistwalker was founded in 2004 by Final Fantasy creator Hironobu Sakaguchi, who produced Fantasian. The studio frequently collaborates with longtime Final Fantasy composer Nobuo Uematsu, who also worked on Fantasian as the composer. To date, Mistwalker has released multiple critically acclaimed games, including Blue Dragon, Lost Odyssey, and The Last Story.

Fantasian uses similar turn-based design conventions as were found in many of the most classic Final Fantasy games. The title also implements several quality-of-life modernizations, such as the ability to skip random encounters with enemy types you've already defeated until they choose to fight them all at once. Despite being a mobile title, Fantasian's ties to Apple Arcade means it does not include any microtransactions or paid DLC.

Fantasian Neo Dimension arrives on Nintendo Switch this holiday season.
articles.title: Final Fantasy Creator's Apple Arcade Exclusive Fantasian Arrives On Switch This Year

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Nintendo kicked off its June 2024 Nintendo Direct presentation with the surprise reveal of a new Mario & Luigi game. This is the first new entry (there were some remakes a few years ago) in nine years. The game is subtitled Brothership and is apparently a "seafaring adventure" that will include new evolved "Bros moves".

The game is coming to Nintendo Switch November 7. A big question mark that remains is who is the developer? The series was created by and developed by AlphaDream, but the studio closed down in 2019.
articles.title: Mario & Luigi: Brothership Is An RPG Releasing Later This Year

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
Yars Rising is the successor of the 1982 Atari classic Yars' Revenge. However, on the surface, it has little to do with the original game created by Howard Scott Warshaw. After all, one is a 2D space shooter while another is a modernized sci-fi Metroidvania. However, with homages to Atari and gaming's past galore, all developed by a renowned studio like WayForward, this release could be one to look forward to when it arrives on its newly announced September release date.

Taking control of a hacker named Emi (codename Yar), players must blast, hack, and sneak their way through various areas. As she progresses, she unlocks new powers that allow her to take out enemies more easily and, in true Metroidvania fashion, access new areas. Yars Rising is published by Atari and pays homage to the company's past, including bosses and minigames that borrow gameplay elements from classic Atari titles.

Though the game is coming to a broader array of platforms, PlayStation 5 and Switch players can pick up physical editions of the game. We recently had a chance to go hands-on with Yars Rising and included our impressions in our list of the coolest things we saw at Summer Game Fest. To read that entry and see the rest of the list, head here. Yars Rising arrives on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC on September 10.
articles.title: Yars Rising Blends Metroidvania, Mega Man, And Stealth This September

However, for many, those are unlikely to be the highlight of this batch of releases. articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Elden Ring fans are likely counting down the seconds until the release of its hotly anticipated Shadow of the Erdtree expansion this Friday. For those planning to dive into the experience the millisecond it becomes available, developer From Software has one request: no spoilers.

In an X post, the developer shared a short message kindly requesting players to be cool to each other and not go out of their way spoiling the expansion's content online. The message reads:

Greetings, Tarnished. With the release of the expansion of Elden Ring, Shadow of the Erdtree, please be mindful of spoilers for those who want to tread into the Realm of Shadow with nothing but their determination and their minds unclouded.  Thank you for your cooperation.

Despite this reasonable request, if you're worried about spoilers and don't plan on shutting yourself inside on June 21 and ignoring the outside world until you complete Shadow of the Erdtree, you'll probably want to mute any mentions of it on social media; just to be safe. 

But if you don't care about getting a small taste of what Shadow of the Erdtree entails, you can check out our recent hands-on preview or watch us tour a slice of the game in this episode of New Gameplay Today.
articles.title: From Software Politely Asks Players Not To Spoil Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree

articles.description:
Developer Arc System Works has revealed Guilty Gear Strive: Dual Rulers, an anime adaptation based on its hit 2021 fighting game. Though there's no release date or window in sight, Arc System Works says Sanzigen Studios is producing the anime. Notably, Sanzigen Studios is the same studio behind protagonist Sol Badguy's "Find Your Way" music video in Guilty Gear Strive. 

As for what to expect from a plot perspective, Arc System Works has revealed little, though it says Dual Rulers will be at this year's Anime Expo 2024 in July. 

"Shigeru Morikawa (famous for Argonavis the Movie: Axia) will direct," the Dual Rulers announcement reads. "Others attached to the project include Guilty Gear writer Norimitsu Kaihō for series composition and Seiji Mizushima (famous for Mobile Suit Gundam 00, Fullmetal Alchemist) as associate producer."

Here's a look at Dual Rulers' key art: 

What do you hope Dual Rulers is about? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Guilty Gear Strive Anime Adaptation Called 'Dual Rulers' Announced

articles.description:
Madden NFL 25 (the new one, not the bizarrely titled 25th-anniversary entry of the same name from 2013) has found its cover athlete. Hot off his run to a near-victory in Super Bowl LVIII comes San Francisco 49er running back Christian McCaffrey.

The reigning NFL Offensive Player of the Year will grace the standard and Deluxe Editions. You can view both covers in the gallery below.

 

EA has yet to detail Madden 25’s gameplay but teases the next evolution of current-gen/PC exclusive features such as FieldSense, new commentary and presentation, and updates to Franchise and other modes. A press release states EA plans to announce gameplay details "soon." 

Madden NFL 25 launches on August 16 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC. You can read our review of last year's Madden NFL 24 here. For the first time in years, Madden won't be EA's only licensed football sim this year, as EA Sports College Football makes its comeback on July 19. You can watch the first trailer here.
articles.title: San Francisco 49ers’ Christian McCaffrey Graces Madden NFL 25 Cover

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Netflix had released a new trailer for Season 2 of Arcane, the hit animated series set in the League of Legends universe. Set to premiere in November, show creators Christian Linke and Alex Yee confirm the upcoming season will be the show's last.

Season 2 is billed as "the final chapter" and will center on Jinx's attack on the Council, which will be the centerpiece of the escalating Piltover/Zaun conflict. Hailee Steinfeld (Vi) and Ella Purnell (Jinx) will reprise their roles in Season 2. While Arcane will conclude, Christian Link stated during a League of Legends dev update today that it won't be the last animated tale based on the franchise. 

“Arcane is just the beginning of our larger storytelling journey and partnership with the wonderful animation studio that is Fortiche," said Linke. "From the very beginning, since we started working on this project, we had a very specific ending in mind, which means the story of Arcane wraps up with this second season. But Arcane is just the first of many stories that we want to tell in Runeterra.”

You can watch the first teaser for Arcane Season 2 here. For more on League of Legends, check out our in-depth preview of 2XKO, the franchise's upcoming fighting game.
articles.title: Arcane Season 2, Which Will Be The Final Chapter, Gets A New Teaser Trailer Ahead Of November Premiere

In the gameplay tr…

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Marvel's Spider-Man 2 is getting an update on June 18 that "addresses some community feedback and adds stability improvements to the game," but the more exciting detail is the addition of eight new suits, one of which is in reference to the Spider-Verse films.

A suit inspired by Peter B. Parker's look will be available for Peter Parker, seen below, although it does lack his telltale gut. The other seven suits, which can be seen on PlayStation's blog, have been created by guest designers KidSuper, Vini Jr, Lando Norris, and Rina Sawayama. There are also a few suits referencing specific Spider-Man lore, and a new Mile Morales suit (seen above) that "is reminiscent of classic cartoons and comics of old."

For more on the web-slinger latest video game adventure, you can read Game Informer's Marvel's Spider-Man 2 review here.
articles.title: An Into The Spider-Verse Costume And More Are Coming To Spider-Man 2 Later This Month

Assassin's Creed Shadows got its first gameplay showing during today's Ubisoft Forward. An extended video shows off two different gameplay sections for its dual protagonists: the samurai Yasuke and the ninja Naoe.

You can read our extensive preview breaking down these sequences here, or you can watch how each of these assassins use their respective talents to relieve enemies of their lives in the video below. 

Assassin's Creed: Shadows lanches on November 15 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

Assassin's Creed Shadows is the answer to that oft-repeated request, but it's far more than that, thanks to the introduction of a second protagonist, Yasuke the samurai. He's a playable historical figure (a first for the series) and his approach varies wildly from the shinobi protagonist, Naoe. We got a first-hand lo…

Unfortunately, the tease…

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Prince of Persia: The Sands Of Time reemerged during Ubisoft's Forward event, but only slightly. Basically, Ubisoft confirmed the game is still in development, but it won't be releasing until 2026.

The game has hit some development difficulties over to course of its creation. When announced, Ubisoft Pune and Ubisoft Mumbai were said to be developing the game, but in 2022 it was shared that development duties would be handed over to Ubisoft Montreal. It seems at that time development was effectively fully reset because it will be some time before release.

For more on Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake, head here. For a look at the original game, you can check out our recent episode or Replay below.
articles.title: Prince Of Persia: The Sands Of Time Remake Is Coming In 2026

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Peruvian IP protection authority has issued two new injunctions, requiring ISPs to block nearly two dozen sports streaming domains. The orders come at the request of 1190 Peru, which exploits various sports leagues, including the local football league. While not all blocking requests were honored, this is the first 'dynamic' order, allowing the targeted domains to be updated. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Football League Scores ‘Dynamic’ Pirate Site Blocking Orders in Peru

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
In 2023, rightsholders monitoring French internet users submitted 2.6 million complaints to the authorities after determining illegal sharing of pirated content on peer-to-peer networks, including BitTorrent. For the whole of 2023, a total of 3,844 subscribers were labeled 'grossly negligent' after receiving a third warning while 1,526 cases were sent to the public prosecutor. A relatively small number, just 234, received a financial penalty.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: 2.6M Piracy Reports Against French Users Resulted in 234 Financial Penalties

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Less than six months ago, manga reader app Tachiyomi was forced to call it quits following legal threats from South Korean publisher Kakao. A popular project fork, Aniyomi, introduced anime into the mix, accessed using extensions from the app's 200+ strong library. A single DMCA notice from Sony Pictures has now taken all but three extensions offline.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sony DMCA Notice Nukes 200 Aniyomi Extensions as Tachiyomi Fork Feels Heat

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Cloudflare protects and facilitates access to millions of sites and services on the web. The company also offers an IPFS gateway, making it easier to access content on the censorship-resistant storage network. Takedown notices for this gateway have skyrocketed, according to the most recent transparency report, but that won’t be for long. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cloudflare IPFS ‘Takedowns’ Skyrocket, But Not For Long

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire' tops the chart, followed by 'Hit Man'. ‘The Fall Guy'' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 06/17/2024

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Anti-piracy coalition ACE has several new targets in its sights, ranging from IPTV services and piracy apps, to popular streaming portals such as Anitaku, Goojara and KickassAnime. The names are revealed in several new subpoenas, requested by the Motion Picture Association. While this legal information gathering tool can be effective, it's not perfect.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: ACE Subpoenas Target IPTV Services, Piracy Apps, and Streaming Portals

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Criminal copyright infringement offenses prosecuted under Russia's Criminal Code are expected to plummet by a quarter, thanks to a new law signed by President Putin this week. The amendments aim to "liberalize and humanize" Russian legislation in the area of copyright and related rights, by drastically increasing the threshold for infringement to be considered 'large scale'. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Russia ‘Humanizes’ Criminal Copyright Law, ‘Large Scale’ Piracy Cut By 25%

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Popular torrent site TorrentGalaxy has gone 'offline' overnight. While downtime is quite common for pirate sites, a mysterious statement by the team is open for interpretation, leading some to believe that it will not return anytime soon. Since the site is a prominent source of new movie and TV show releases, this is a big deal.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: TorrentGalaxy Goes Offline With Mysterious Message to Users (Update)

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The company behind notorious anti-tamper technology Denuvo, filed an interesting DMCA takedown notice at GitHub this week. According to Irdeto, unnamed parties cloned the company's website, registered a similar domain, and ran their own mail server behind the scenes. A short investigation by TF suggests that the culprits may have known Irdeto would attempt to track them down and may have left Easter eggs along the way.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Denuvo Owner Shuts Down Clone Sites, Perpertrators Seem Up For a Chase

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A French court has ordered Google, Cloudflare, and Cisco to poison their DNS resolvers to prevent circumvention of blocking measures, targeting around 117 pirate sports streaming domains. The move is another anti-piracy escalation for broadcaster Canal+, which also has permission to completely deindex the sites from search engine results. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Google, Cloudflare & Cisco Will Poison DNS to Stop Piracy Block Circumvention

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
European football federation UEFA is cracking down on pirate EURO 2024 live streams, before they've even started. The enforcement actions show that the organization is on high alert. Meanwhile, the EU Intellectual Property Office adds support by clarifying that cheers of legitimate viewers 'mean more' than those from pirates. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: UEFA Targets Pirate EURO 2024 Live Streams Before They Start

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
According to the U.S. government, subscription IPTV services Jetflicks and iStreamitAll were once two of the largest piracy platforms in the country. Several defendants are now on trial in Las Vegas in a case that generated 19TB of data and 175,000 pages of print discovery, and has taken five years to prepare. After accusing MPA and HBO executives of presenting prejudicial evidence to the jury, the lead defendant called for a mistrial; the government didn't give an inch.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Biggest IPTV Piracy Trial in U.S. History Underway and Already Controversial

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
GitHub has removed several repositories following a copyright complaint from Plex. Through its anti-piracy partner, the streaming software service complained about code that enables 'Godmode' on its media server and provides free access to paid Plex Pass features.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Plex Cracks Down on Media Server ‘Hacks’

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
As part of a voluntary agreement with copyright holders, German Internet service providers must block structurally infringing websites. The list expanded recently with Romslab, a site that offers links to pirated games and emulators such as Yuzu and Ryujinx. Official records redact the name of the game company that requested the blockade, but several signs point in the direction of a 135-year-old Japanese corporation. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: German ISPs Block Romslab Due to Widespread Game Piracy

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Italy's solution to IPTV piracy is already operating beyond the limits of its design. Piracy Shield launched in February under new law that compels all 300+ of the country's ISPs to block pirate streaming services. It now transpires that Italy's blocking system was only designed to accommodate 70 ISPs and now times out under the strain. By end of 2024, Piracy Shield Phase 2 will make its debut.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Piracy Shield 2: Just When IPTV Pirates Thought it Was Safe

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
RedFox, the outfit behind popular ripping software AnyStream and AnyDVD, seems to have disappeared. The domain name is inaccessible after A records were removed, and its mail server is unreachable too.  Despite days of downtime, there is no sign of enforcement action and no word from the developers either. Meanwhile, its competitor, StreamFab, is picking up new users.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Redfox Disappearance Puts a Spotlight on Defiant StreamFab

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Google's relationships with major rightsholders seemed to be headed in a positive direction. Yet, according to a new lawsuit filed by the world's largest educational publishers, their situation could hardly be worse. They accuse Google of promoting pirate sites, profiting from piracy, and giving pirates preferential treatment, in part by limiting publishers' ability to advertise legal products.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Google “Profits From Pirated Textbooks” Publishers’ Lawsuit Claims

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
High prices are among the most commonly cited reasons why people pirate movies, music, books, and other content. But does this mean that lower prices have an effect on piracy in the real world? A clever natural experiment, conducted by academic researchers, shows that price matters. The study found that lower book prices significantly reduced indirect visits to pirate sites.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Cheaper Prices Reduce Indirect Visits to Pirate Sites, Research Finds

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
As part of a copyright infringement lawsuit against DoodStream, the cyberlocker platform was handed orders by a court in India to remove links to all content owned by the major Hollywood studios, Netflix, Amazon, and Apple, within 24 hours. When that failed to happen, the terms of the injunction seemed to be up for negotiation, at least for a while. Having done little to convince the court that infringement wouldn't continue, DoodStream's operators and associates are now banned from running the site.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Court Bans DoodStream’s Owners & Associates From Running The Site

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (DreamMaster)
articles.description:
In a universe where bagels meet bars, the BAGEL engine has been perfectly toasted, and the ScummVM team is now ready to serve a slice of The Space Bar nostalgia. No, it’s not the key on your keyboard. Rather, it’s a detective story set on a distant planet. Important data has been stolen, and the perpetrator is a shape-shifter laying low in a spaceport dive bar until he can flee off-planet. You play a hard-boiled detective who has the skill to psychically visit bar patrons’ memories to gather clues and narrow down suspects.
This is thanks to the kind people at ZOOM Platform, who provided us with the original game sources to work with. Help us test the game by grabbing a daily build. Read through our testing guidelines. The game features a lot of options to chat around with bar patrons’ and do various actions in the different flashbacks. So we really need people to spend time experimenting and make sure everything works correctly. And please take some screenshots along the way.
If you don’t own The Space Bar, you can try one of the free demos or purchase it digitally from the ZOOM Platform. Testing is also available on Steam via a beta branch, check the Steam announcement for more details.
Now, good luck, and fingers crossed you can find the perp. Otherwise, your bureau chief will have you getting up close and personal with toilet duties for the rest of your career. Oh, and PS: The viewpoints of different aliens differ. For the Bartender, who has segmented eyes, even the original developers felt it was difficult and left in a cheat key of ScrollLock to switch back to a single viewpoint. Feel free to use it if, at any point, the flashback becomes too much for you :)
>
articles.title: It’s a Bar... In Space!
